lazyTrees

Class FoothillTunesStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • lazyTrees.FoothillTunesStore

  • public class FoothillTunesStore
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates the scenario of buying and adding songs to a store's inventory. FoothillTunesStore which will store a binary search tree. The implementation of BST will use lazy deletion to store SongEntry objects.
    Author:
    Foothill College, Bita M, Anuva B

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      FoothillTunesStore()
      Instantiates tunes to be a LazySearchTree of SongEntry objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FoothillTunesStore

        public FoothillTunesStore()
        Instantiates tunes to be a LazySearchTree of SongEntry objects.

    • Method Detail

      • addToTunes

        public void addToTunes(java.lang.String title,
                       int duration,
                       java.lang.String artist_name,
                       java.lang.String genre)
        Add a new SongEntry with the title as a parameter into a LazySearchTree of SongEntry objects. If there is a song already with same title, increase amount by one, if not create a new title.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the song to be added to the LazySearchTree of SongEntry objects.

      • removeFromTunes

        public void removeFromTunes(java.lang.String title,
                            int duration,
                            java.lang.String artist_name,
                            java.lang.String genre)
        If the song is in the tunes tree, decrease the count by one. If only one song is left, remove it from the tunes tree.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to be removed from the tunes tree.

      • showFirstAndLastTitle

        public void showFirstAndLastTitle(java.lang.String message)
        Display the first item and last time of the soft tree in lexical order.

      • displayTunesStore

        protected void displayTunesStore(java.lang.String message,
                                 boolean showTree)
        Shows the state of the tree by displaying: - the *hard* inventory, which includes deleted nodes. - the *soft* inventory, which excludes deleted nodes.
        Parameters:
        message - Additional details about the state.
        showTree - Set to true if we want to display the contents of the tree

      • binarySearch

        private static int binarySearch(SongEntry[] songs,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                int firstIndex,
                                int lastIndex)
        Binary search algorithm to efficiently search for a title in the sorted array of songs. Running time is logarithmic - O (Log N)
        Parameters:
        songs - Sorted array of songs
        title - String representing title to search for
        firstIndex - integer representing smallest index of the array
        lastIndex - integer representing largest index of the array
        Returns:
        the index of the element in the list that matches the search key if it is contained in the list. Otherwise, it returns -1 (negative)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Reads an input file that contains the prices of the different items. Then stores and outputs a list of items we can buy given the condition of how much money you have in your wallet. We're at a cash only store. So, no checks or credit purchases!
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
